title: Holy Spirit, ministry and work of

children.title: Holy Spirit, and assurance
children.comment: The Holy Spirit assures believers of their standing in Christ and their eternal salvation.

children.title: Holy Spirit, and grace
Holy Spirit, and love
children.comment: Heartfelt concern and steadfast practical care is part of the evidence of the Holy Spirit's presence in the lives of believers.

children.title: The Holy Spirit's work and fruit includes the characteristic of love
The Holy Spirit fills believers with the love of God
The Holy Spirit enables believers to live with one another in love
The gift of the Holy Spirit results in practical love
Love is essential in the exercise of the gifts of the Holy Spirit
Holy Spirit, and mission
children.comment: The Holy Spirit directs and empowers believers in their missionary tasks, bearing witness to Jesus Christ and preparing the hearts of men and women to respond to him in faith.

children.title: The Holy Spirit equips God's people
He inspired the prophets
He empowered Jesus Christ as Messiah
He empowered the first Christians

secondaryrefs.comment: The outpouring of God's Spirit begins to extend beyond the Jews.

children.title: He empowers God's people today
The Holy Spirit accomplishes the mission of God
He convicts of sin
He directs mission
He inspires witnesses and speakers
He gives signs and wonders
The Holy Spirit's missionary activity is ongoing
He cares for God's people involved in mission
He sanctifies God's people
He encourages God's people
Holy Spirit, and peace
children.comment: The Holy Spirit brings a sense of well-being, contentment and wholeness to believers whatever their outward circumstances. Peace is therefore an indication of the Holy Spirit's presence.

children.title: Peace is part of the nature of the Holy Spirit
The Spirit is likened to a dove, the symbol of peace
As part of the Godhead the Spirit is the God of peace
Peace is a resource that the Holy Spirit gives to believers

seealsos.comment: The Greek word ``parakletos'' means ``one called alongside'', hence ``comforter'' or ``advocate''

children.title: The fruit of the Spirit includes peace
The Holy Spirit brings peace to God's people concerning their circumstances
He changes situations to bring peace
He brings peace of mind to those facing difficult situations
The Holy Spirit brings peaceful relationships
Between believers
Between believers and God the Father

seealsos.comment: The result of the Spirit's work is contrasted with fear, the opposite of peace.

children.title: Holy Spirit, and praise
children.comment: The Holy Spirit inspires believers to extol, worship and thank God. His aim is to glorify the Father and the Son.

children.title: The promise that the Holy Spirit will bring praise
The Holy Spirit inspires praise
True praise must be inspired by the Spirit
The Spirit prompts praise

secondaryrefs.comment: The Spirit prompts Jesus Christ to praise the Father.

children.title: Evidence of the Holy Spirit's work inspires praise
The Spirit's convicting work inspires praise
The Spirit's converting work inspires praise
The Holy Spirit activates the church's praise
Holy Spirit, and prayer
children.comment: The Holy Spirit intercedes for God's people and also prompts their petitions, supplications and thanksgivings.

children.title: The Holy Spirit enables God's children to address him as ``Abba''
The role of the Holy Spirit in prayer
He prompts supplication

primaryrefs.comment: ``a spirit'' (NIV text) or ``the Spirit'' (NIV footnote).

children.title: He inspires prayers of praise
He inspires praying in tongues
He intercedes for believers
The evidence of the Holy Spirit's work prompts praise and thanks
Believers are exhorted to pray in the Spirit
The love of the Holy Spirit is a motive for prayer
Holy Spirit, and preaching
children.comment: True Christian preaching is grounded in the word of God and applied by the Holy Spirit to its audience.

children.title: The Holy Spirit is identified with the proclaimed word of God
The Holy Spirit sends God's messengers
The Holy Spirit equips, inspires and instructs God's messengers
He inspires the OT prophets
He inspires Jesus Christ's teaching ministry
The apostles preach in the Spirit's power
The Holy Spirit teaches and applies the preached word of God to its hearers
Holy Spirit, and prophecy
Holy Spirit, and regeneration
children.comment: God's Spirit works to bring the gift of new birth and renewal to those who have been called to faith.

children.title: The Holy Spirit's work is promised
Jesus Christ proclaims the Holy Spirit's work
The Holy Spirit's work brings salvation

primaryrefs.comment: ``washing'' (apparently a reference to baptism) signifies regeneration.

children.title: Regeneration is a creative work of God's Spirit alone
It cannot be achieved by human means
It cannot be achieved through the works of the law
Holy Spirit, and sanctification
children.comment: The work of the Holy Spirit in enabling believers to lead holy lives, dedicated to the service of God and conformed to his likeness.

children.title: The Spirit of holiness is promised

primaryrefs.comment: ``fire'' implies the Holy Spirit's work of purification and judgment.

children.title: Sanctification is a special work of the Holy Spirit
The Holy Spirit requires believers to be sanctified

primaryrefs.comment: Sanctification is a necessary part of being a Christian.

children.title: The Holy Spirit enables believers to be sanctified
The Holy Spirit produces sanctification
The process of sanctification
The Holy Spirit makes believers more like Jesus Christ
The Holy Spirit helps mortify sinful human nature
The Holy Spirit is opposed to natural desires
Examples of people sanctified by the Holy Spirit
Holy Spirit, and Scripture
children.comment: The Holy Spirit inspired the original writing of all the Scriptures, and illumines their meaning to believers.

children.title: The Holy Spirit inspired the writing of Scripture
The Spirit inspired the writers of the OT
The NT recognises OT writings as inspired by the Holy Spirit

primaryrefs.comment: ``God-breathed'' means ``breathed out by God'' rather than ``inspired''

children.title: The Spirit inspired the writers of the NT

primaryrefs.comment: This revelation by the Spirit probably includes the apostles' understanding of the gospel and their preaching as well as the writings of the NT.

children.title: The Holy Spirit illumines the meaning of Scripture

primaryrefs.comment: ``what God has freely given'' refers to ``God's secret wisdom'' (verse 7), the ``deep things of God'' (verse 10) and the ``thoughts of God'' (verse 11).

children.title: The relationship between the word and the Holy Spirit
The association of God's Spirit and breath with his word(s)

secondaryrefs.comment: ``word'' here probably means ``the gospel'' rather than Scripture as a whole.

children.title: The Spirit is essential for obeying God's law

primaryrefs.comment: Reliance on the letter of the law alone is useless.

children.title: The Spirit enables believers to fulfil the law
Holy Spirit, anointing of
children.comment: ``Anoint'' means to set someone apart, to authorise and equip him or her for a task of spiritual importance. Jesus Christ is set apart by the work of the Holy Spirit for his ministry of preaching, healing and deliverance. The Holy Spirit sets Christians apart for their ministry in Christ's name.

children.title: Jesus Christ anointed by the Holy Spirit
The Messiah's anointing is predicted

primaryrefs.comment: ``Messiah'' means ``anointed one''.

children.title: The Spirit anoints Jesus Christ at the start of his ministry
Jesus Christ declares his anointing
The first Christians declare Jesus Christ's anointing
Evidence pointing to the Spirit's anointing in Jesus Christ's ministry
Believers anointed by the Holy Spirit
The Spirit anoints God's chosen people
Anointing enables Christians to stand firm
Anointing guards Christians against falsehood
Holy Spirit, baptism with
children.comment: A divine act, promised by John the Baptist and by Jesus Christ, whereby the Holy Spirit initiates Christians into realised union and communion with the glorified Jesus Christ, thus equipping and enabling them for sanctity and service.

children.title: Baptism with the Holy Spirit promised
John the Baptist anticipates baptism with the Spirit
Jesus Christ promises baptism with the Spirit
The gift of the Holy Spirit followed Jesus Christ's glorification
Instances of baptism with the Holy Spirit
The gift of the Holy Spirit is for all believers at the outset of their Christian lives
This gift of the Holy Spirit links believers together in the one body of Christ
Holy Spirit, blasphemy against
children.comment: The denial of the action of the Holy Spirit in the ministry of Jesus Christ, or the attribution of his works to demonic influence.

children.title: Jesus Christ warns against blasphemy
Blasphemy as erroneously attributing the work of the Holy Spirit to demonic influence
Jesus Christ is accused of being possessed by demons
Jesus Christ is accused of casting out demons by demonic power
Jesus Christ refutes these charges
Blasphemy as acting in ways which deny the Holy Spirit's work
Holy Spirit, conviction of
children.comment: The Holy Spirit convinces human beings of sin and of the reality of forgiveness through Jesus Christ.

children.title: The Holy Spirit convicts the world of sin and its consequences
Ways in which the Holy Spirit brings conviction
Through preaching
Through the exercise of spiritual gifts
The reality of the Holy Spirit's conviction in the lives of believers
He brings illumination
He gives assurance about their new relationship with God
He convicts of the need for constant change
Holy Spirit, filling with
children.comment: To be filled with the Holy Spirit is to be energised and controlled by the third person of the Godhead in such a way that under the acknowledged lordship of Jesus Christ the full presence and power of God are experienced. Spirit-filling leads to renewal, obedience, boldness in testimony and an arresting quality in believers' lives.

children.title: People filled with the Holy Spirit before the ministry of Jesus Christ
In the OT

secondaryrefs.comment: Bezalel filled with the Spirit for artwork on the tabernacle
Joshua filled with the Spirit to succeed Moses

children.title: In the events surrounding the birth of John the Baptist

secondaryrefs.comment: John the Baptist filled with the Spirit from birth
Elizabeth filled with the Spirit and speaks words of praise
Zechariah prophesies about the life of John and God's salvation

children.title: Jesus Christ is full of the Holy Spirit
NT terminology

primaryrefs.comment: While these terms are virtually synonymous when used of initial experiences of the Spirit, ``filled'' is also used to designate subsequent experiences and renewings of the same divine power, while the other terms are not.

children.title: ``Be filled with the Spirit'': an apostolic command

primaryrefs.comment: The present tense of the verb implies the need to be regularly filled and re-filled with the Spirit.

children.title: ``Filled with the Spirit'': a conscious experience of God's power
``Full of the Spirit'': a consistent quality of Christian character
``Filled with the Spirit'': the inspiration to speak words of witness, challenge or rebuke

secondaryrefs.comment: Stephen testifying to the Sanhedrin, seeing the glory of God

children.title: Characteristics of the Spirit-filled life
The Spirit of Christ should rule believers' lives
The Spirit produces fruit of Christlike character
The Spirit brings liberty
Being filled with the Spirit often leads to words of praise
Characteristics linked with the fulness of the Spirit
Holy Spirit, fruit of
children.comment: The living presence of the Holy Spirit in believers leads to Christlike virtues within them, just as a living tree will bear good fruit.

children.title: God expects his people to bear spiritual fruit

seealsos.comment: ``fruit'' is a term used to indicate the produce or outcome of a person's life

children.title: The fruit of the Spirit leads to believers becoming Christlike
The gift of the Spirit begins this lifelong process
Christlike qualities are contrasted with sinful ones
The fruit of Spirit-filled living

primaryrefs.comment: ``fruit'' is singular, emphasising that these qualities are mutually dependent aspects of Christian living.

children.title: Examples of the fruit of the Spirit
Love
Joy
Peace
Patience
Kindness
Goodness
Faithfulness

secondaryrefs.comment: God's faithfulness is also here presented as the reason for faithfulness

children.title: Gentleness
Self-control
Other evidence of the Holy Spirit's activity
The evidence of the fruit of the Spirit is a result of divine activity, not of human effort
Holy Spirit, gift of
children.comment: In the OT the gift of the Holy Spirit was restricted to individuals for particular tasks, but at Pentecost and on subsequent occasions, the Holy Spirit is given to all believers.

children.title: The gift of the Holy Spirit in the OT
The Spirit is given to individuals for specific tasks
The gift of the Spirit can be withdrawn
The gift of the Holy Spirit is foretold
He is promised by John the Baptist
He is promised by Jesus Christ
The gift of the Holy Spirit before Pentecost
Individuals filled with the Spirit
Jesus Christ receives the gift of the Spirit
Jesus Christ bids his disciples receive the Holy Spirit
The gift of the Holy Spirit at Pentecost and after
At Pentecost
The Spirit was given on later occasions
The gift of the Spirit is for all believers
God's willingness to give the Spirit
God's purposes require the gift of the Holy Spirit
To give assurance of acceptance by God
To convict the world of sin
To provide spiritual gifts
To work miracles, signs and wonders
To give boldness in preaching and witnessing
To cultivate the fruit of the Spirit
To sanctify the believer
Holy Spirit, gifts of
Holy Spirit, guidance of
children.comment: The Holy Spirit gives guidance to groups and individuals facing challenges, decisions and difficulties. Such guidance, however given, effectively specifies the will of God in situations of choice within the biblically established guidelines of righteousness.

children.title: Knowing divine guidance is associated with the presence of the Holy Spirit
The Holy Spirit guides Jesus Christ in his ministry
The Holy Spirit guides the church in its corporate decisions
The Holy Spirit's guidance of believers
The Holy Spirit guides individual believers
He guides through the word of God, spiritually understood and kept before the mind
He guides in prayer
He guides through spiritual gifts
He guides in Christian living
He guides in witness and evangelism
He guides in ministry
He guides into a knowledge of truth
Holy Spirit, in creation
children.comment: The Holy Spirit was active with the Father and the Word in creation. He is the active power of God present within creation.

children.title: The Holy Spirit is involved in creative activity

seealsos.comment: The word translated ``breath'' is the same word that is used for ``Spirit''.

children.title: The Holy Spirit is the breath of life throughout creation
The Holy Spirit is present everywhere in creation
The Holy Spirit controls nature and history
The Holy Spirit enables creative achievement
Holy Spirit, in life of Jesus Christ
children.comment: From the moment of his conception Jesus Christ was empowered by the Holy Spirit. Christ's possession of the Holy Spirit was demonstrated publicly at several points in his ministry. After his resurrection the Holy Spirit demonstrated him to be the Son of God.

children.title: OT prophecies of the Holy Spirit in Jesus Christ's life
Jesus Christ was conceived by the Holy Spirit
The Holy Spirit at Jesus Christ's baptism
Jesus Christ lived by the Holy Spirit
Jesus Christ's ministry was empowered by the Holy Spirit
In preaching
In working miracles
Jesus Christ was vindicated by the Holy Spirit
Jesus Christ promises the Holy Spirit to his disciples
Jesus Christ gives the Holy Spirit to his disciples
Holy Spirit, in OT
children.comment: The OT portrays the Holy Spirit as being active in creation, in equipping individuals for skilled tasks and in inspiring prophecy and revelation.

children.title: The Holy Spirit as the presence of God
He is active in creation
He is present everywhere
His sovereignty
All life is dependent on the Spirit

primaryrefs.comment: NIV footnote at verse 14.

children.title: He is present with God's people
The Holy Spirit equips individuals
For leadership

seealsos.comment: The gift of prophecy was given temporarily to the elders in order to establish them as leaders of God's people

children.title: In bringing revelation
By empowering the prophet
By giving special strength
By guidance
In planning
In craftsmanship
In building
The Holy Spirit inspires
Prophecy
Teaching
Praise
A declaration of allegiance
Examples of the awareness of the Holy Spirit's activity
Examples of grieving the Holy Spirit
Promises of the Holy Spirit for the future
The Spirit and the Messiah
The outpouring of the Spirit
Holy Spirit, in the church
children.comment: The church depends upon the activity of the Holy Spirit, without which its effective and faithful service is impossible.

children.title: The Holy Spirit forms the church
The Holy Spirit indwells the church

primaryrefs.comment: ``you'' here is plural and refers to the whole church.

children.title: The Holy Spirit enables the church to function as the body of Christ
The Holy Spirit enables Christian unity
The church worships, serves and speaks by the Holy Spirit
The church worships by the Spirit
The church serves by the Spirit
The church speaks by the Spirit
The Holy Spirit communicates Jesus Christ's message to the church
The Holy Spirit and the church's mission
The church fulfils its mission by the Spirit
The Spirit directs the church's missionary enterprise
Holy Spirit, indwelling of
children.comment: The Holy Spirit dwells within Jesus Christ and his disciples. Recognisable results in believers' lives include Christlikeness and the fruit of the Spirit.

children.title: The indwelling of the Holy Spirit in the OT
The Holy Spirit indwells Jesus Christ
The indwelling of the Holy Spirit is promised to believers
The Holy Spirit indwells believers
Results of the Holy Spirit's indwelling in believers
The Holy Spirit guarantees life
The Holy Spirit assures believers that they belong to God
Wisdom and insight are received
Strength is received
Preaching and public testimony is aided
The moral law is obeyed
The fruit of the Spirit is displayed
Those without the Holy Spirit's indwelling are not Christlike
Holy Spirit, inspiration of
children.comment: The Holy Spirit inspires prophecy and gives knowledge of God, insight and wisdom. Scripture declares itself to have been inspired by God.

children.title: The Holy Spirit inspired the writers of Scripture
The Holy Spirit inspires believers to honour Jesus Christ
Purposes of the Holy Spirit's inspiration
The Holy Spirit inspired prophecy
People aware of the Holy Spirit's inspiration
The Holy Spirit gives revelation
God's purposes revealed
The Messiah revealed to Simeon
Visions given
Visions interpreted
Dreams interpreted
David's plans for the temple
Wisdom and knowledge are given
God's fatherhood revealed to believers
Speech is inspired by the Holy Spirit
Testifying to God
Instruction
Speaking in tongues
Prayer
Holy Spirit, resisting
children.comment: The work of the Holy Spirit can be resisted through disobedience and unbelief.

children.title: Scriptural images of resisting the Holy Spirit
Grieving the Spirit
Resisting the Spirit
Blaspheming against the Spirit
Quenching the Spirit
Lying to the Spirit
Testing the Spirit
Ways in which the Holy Spirit is resisted
Through sin
Through rebellion
Through hardness of heart
Through spiritual blindness
Holy Spirit, sealing of
children.comment: Based on the practice of sealing letters, documents and property, the Holy Spirit is described as being a seal on the lives of God's people, affirming their Christian character, marking them out as belonging to God and guarding them from the world and the devil.

children.title: The Holy Spirit's seal on the life of Jesus Christ

primaryrefs.comment: The Greek implies a once-and-for-all sealing at a particular time in the past and probably alludes to the baptism of Jesus Christ when the Holy Spirit came upon him.

children.title: The seal of the Holy Spirit in the life of believers
The seal marks God's ownership
The seal acts as a guarantee of redemption
Holy Spirit, the life-giver
children.comment: Through the Holy Spirit, God gives birth to and supports both natural and spiritual life. For this reason, Scripture likens the Holy Spirit to life-giving water.

children.title: The creating Spirit (or breath) of God gives and sustains life
The Holy Spirit gives new life
The Holy Spirit is the life-giver in the conception of Jesus Christ
The Holy Spirit gives resurrection life to Jesus Christ
The Holy Spirit brings new spiritual life
The Spirit sets believers free from bondage to works that lead to death
The Holy Spirit is described as life-giving water

primaryrefs.comment: Words spoken by Jesus Christ at the Feast of Tabernacles.

children.title: Holy Spirit, witness of
children.comment: The Holy Spirit bears witness to the person and work of Jesus Christ, and enables believers to bear effective witness to him.

children.title: The Holy Spirit bears witness to Jesus Christ
The Spirit's testimony
At Jesus Christ's baptism
After Jesus Christ's ascension
The Holy Spirit's witness enables believers to be effective
He brings assurance to believers
He gives assurance of the finality of Jesus Christ's saving work
He gives believers confidence in their status as children of God
Holy Spirit, work in the world
children.comment: The Holy Spirit, active in the created world, works to show the futility and sinfulness of life without God, and brings a conviction of the presence of God, his righteousness and coming judgment.

children.title: The Holy Spirit is active in the created world
In creation itself
In ordering the natural world
The Holy Spirit is present everywhere in the world
The unbelieving world will not recognise the Holy Spirit

primaryrefs.comment: John uses ``the world'' to describe those who live apart from God.

children.title: The Holy Spirit testifies to the truth
The Holy Spirit convicts the world
The Holy Spirit empowers the church to serve the world in mission

cschildren.title: The Holy Spirit makes an individual a member of Christ
The Holy Spirit assures believers that they have been born anew

primaryrefs.comment: The true sign of belonging to God is not any outward mark on the body, but the regenerating power of the Spirit within.

cschildren.title: The Holy Spirit assures believers that they are God's children
The Holy Spirit assures believers that God loves them
The Holy Spirit assures believers that Jesus Christ lives in them and they in him
The Holy Spirit assures believers that God's power is within them
The fruit of the Spirit is evidence of the believer's standing in Christ

primaryrefs.comment: Spiritual gifts alone are not a sufficient basis for assurance.

cschildren.title: The Holy Spirit assures believers of the significance of Jesus Christ
The Holy Spirit is the first instalment of the believer's inheritance in the kingdom of God
The Holy Spirit assures believers of their final victory in Christ

The Spirit of Christ should rule believers' lives
The Spirit produces fruit of Christlike character
The Spirit brings liberty
Being filled with the Spirit often leads to words of praise
Characteristics linked with the fulness of the Spirit
Holy Spirit, fruit of
children.comment: The living presence of the Holy Spirit in believers leads to Christlike virtues within them, just as a living tree will bear good fruit.

children.title: God expects his people to bear spiritual fruit

seealsos.comment: ``fruit'' is a term used to indicate the produce or outcome of a person's life

children.title: The fruit of the Spirit leads to believers becoming Christlike
The gift of the Spirit begins this lifelong process
Christlike qualities are contrasted with sinful ones
The fruit of Spirit-filled living

primaryrefs.comment: ``fruit'' is singular, emphasising that these qualities are mutually dependent aspects of Christian living.

children.title: Examples of the fruit of the Spirit
Love
Joy
Peace
Patience
Kindness
Goodness
Faithfulness

secondaryrefs.comment: God's faithfulness is also here presented as the reason for faithfulness

children.title: Gentleness
Self-control
Other evidence of the Holy Spirit's activity
The evidence of the fruit of the Spirit is a result of divine activity, not of human effort
Holy Spirit, gift of
children.comment: In the OT the gift of the Holy Spirit was restricted to individuals for particular tasks, but at Pentecost and on subsequent occasions, the Holy Spirit is given to all believers.

children.title: The gift of the Holy Spirit in the OT
The Spirit is given to individuals for specific tasks
The gift of the Spirit can be withdrawn
The gift of the Holy Spirit is foretold
He is promised by John the Baptist
He is promised by Jesus Christ
The gift of the Holy Spirit before Pentecost
Individuals filled with the Spirit
Jesus Christ receives the gift of the Spirit
Jesus Christ bids his disciples receive the Holy Spirit
The gift of the Holy Spirit at Pentecost and after
At Pentecost
The Spirit was given on later occasions
The gift of the Spirit is for all believers
God's willingness to give the Spirit
God's purposes require the gift of the Holy Spirit
To give assurance of acceptance by God
To convict the world of sin
To provide spiritual gifts
To work miracles, signs and wonders
To give boldness in preaching and witnessing
To cultivate the fruit of the Spirit
To sanctify the believer
Holy Spirit, gifts of
Holy Spirit, guidance of
children.comment: The Holy Spirit gives guidance to groups and individuals facing challenges, decisions and difficulties. Such guidance, however given, effectively specifies the will of God in situations of choice within the biblically established guidelines of righteousness.

children.title: Knowing divine guidance is associated with the presence of the Holy Spirit
The Holy Spirit guides Jesus Christ in his ministry
The Holy Spirit guides the church in its corporate decisions
The Holy Spirit's guidance of believers
The Holy Spirit guides individual believers
He guides through the word of God, spiritually understood and kept before the mind
He guides in prayer
He guides through spiritual gifts
He guides in Christian living
He guides in witness and evangelism
He guides in ministry
He guides into a knowledge of truth
Holy Spirit, in creation
children.comment: The Holy Spirit was active with the Father and the Word in creation. He is the active power of God present within creation.

children.title: The Holy Spirit is involved in creative activity

seealsos.comment: The word translated ``breath'' is the same word that is used for ``Spirit''.

children.title: The Holy Spirit is the breath of life throughout creation
The Holy Spirit is present everywhere in creation
The Holy Spirit controls nature and history
The Holy Spirit enables creative achievement
Holy Spirit, in life of Jesus Christ
children.comment: From the moment of his conception Jesus Christ was empowered by the Holy Spirit. Christ's possession of the Holy Spirit was demonstrated publicly at several points in his ministry. After his resurrection the Holy Spirit demonstrated him to be the Son of God.

children.title: OT prophecies of the Holy Spirit in Jesus Christ's life
Jesus Christ was conceived by the Holy Spirit
The Holy Spirit at Jesus Christ's baptism
Jesus Christ lived by the Holy Spirit
Jesus Christ's ministry was empowered by the Holy Spirit
In preaching
In working miracles
Jesus Christ was vindicated by the Holy Spirit
Jesus Christ promises the Holy Spirit to his disciples
Jesus Christ gives the Holy Spirit to his disciples
Holy Spirit, in OT
children.comment: The OT portrays the Holy Spirit as being active in creation, in equipping individuals for skilled tasks and in inspiring prophecy and revelation.

children.title: The Holy Spirit as the presence of God
He is active in creation
He is present everywhere
His sovereignty
All life is dependent on the Spirit

primaryrefs.comment: NIV footnote at verse 14.

children.title: He is present with God's people
The Holy Spirit equips individuals
For leadership

seealsos.comment: The gift of prophecy was given temporarily to the elders in order to establish them as leaders of God's people

children.title: In bringing revelation
By empowering the prophet
By giving special strength
By guidance
In planning
In craftsmanship
In building
The Holy Spirit inspires
Prophecy
Teaching
Praise
A declaration of allegiance
Examples of the awareness of the Holy Spirit's activity
Examples of grieving the Holy Spirit
Promises of the Holy Spirit for the future
The Spirit and the Messiah
The outpouring of the Spirit
Holy Spirit, in the church
children.comment: The church depends upon the activity of the Holy Spirit, without which its effective and faithful service is impossible.

children.title: The Holy Spirit forms the church
The Holy Spirit indwells the church

primaryrefs.comment: ``you'' here is plural and refers to the whole church.

children.title: The Holy Spirit enables the church to function as the body of Christ
The Holy Spirit enables Christian unity
The church worships, serves and speaks by the Holy Spirit
The church worships by the Spirit
The church serves by the Spirit
The church speaks by the Spirit
The Holy Spirit communicates Jesus Christ's message to the church
The Holy Spirit and the church's mission
The church fulfils its mission by the Spirit
The Spirit directs the church's missionary enterprise
Holy Spirit, indwelling of
children.comment: The Holy Spirit dwells within Jesus Christ and his disciples. Recognisable results in believers' lives include Christlikeness and the fruit of the Spirit.

children.title: The indwelling of the Holy Spirit in the OT
The Holy Spirit indwells Jesus Christ
The indwelling of the Holy Spirit is promised to believers
The Holy Spirit indwells believers
Results of the Holy Spirit's indwelling in believers
The Holy Spirit guarantees life
The Holy Spirit assures believers that they belong to God
Wisdom and insight are received
Strength is received
Preaching and public testimony is aided
The moral law is obeyed
The fruit of the Spirit is displayed
Those without the Holy Spirit's indwelling are not Christlike
Holy Spirit, inspiration of
children.comment: The Holy Spirit inspires prophecy and gives knowledge of God, insight and wisdom. Scripture declares itself to have been inspired by God.

children.title: The Holy Spirit inspired the writers of Scripture
The Holy Spirit inspires believers to honour Jesus Christ
Purposes of the Holy Spirit's inspiration
The Holy Spirit inspired prophecy
People aware of the Holy Spirit's inspiration
The Holy Spirit gives revelation
God's purposes revealed
The Messiah revealed to Simeon
Visions given
Visions interpreted
Dreams interpreted
David's plans for the temple
Wisdom and knowledge are given
God's fatherhood revealed to believers
Speech is inspired by the Holy Spirit
Testifying to God
Instruction
Speaking in tongues
Prayer
Holy Spirit, resisting
children.comment: The work of the Holy Spirit can be resisted through disobedience and unbelief.

children.title: Scriptural images of resisting the Holy Spirit
Grieving the Spirit
Resisting the Spirit
Blaspheming against the Spirit
Quenching the Spirit
Lying to the Spirit
Testing the Spirit
Ways in which the Holy Spirit is resisted
Through sin
Through rebellion
Through hardness of heart
Through spiritual blindness
Holy Spirit, sealing of
children.comment: Based on the practice of sealing letters, documents and property, the Holy Spirit is described as being a seal on the lives of God's people, affirming their Christian character, marking them out as belonging to God and guarding them from the world and the devil.

children.title: The Holy Spirit's seal on the life of Jesus Christ

primaryrefs.comment: The Greek implies a once-and-for-all sealing at a particular time in the past and probably alludes to the baptism of Jesus Christ when the Holy Spirit came upon him.

children.title: The seal of the Holy Spirit in the life of believers
The seal marks God's ownership
The seal acts as a guarantee of redemption
Holy Spirit, the life-giver
children.comment: Through the Holy Spirit, God gives birth to and supports both natural and spiritual life. For this reason, Scripture likens the Holy Spirit to life-giving water.

children.title: The creating Spirit (or breath) of God gives and sustains life
The Holy Spirit gives new life
The Holy Spirit is the life-giver in the conception of Jesus Christ
The Holy Spirit gives resurrection life to Jesus Christ
The Holy Spirit brings new spiritual life
The Spirit sets believers free from bondage to works that lead to death
The Holy Spirit is described as life-giving water

primaryrefs.comment: Words spoken by Jesus Christ at the Feast of Tabernacles.

children.title: Holy Spirit, witness of
children.comment: The Holy Spirit bears witness to the person and work of Jesus Christ, and enables believers to bear effective witness to him.

children.title: The Holy Spirit bears witness to Jesus Christ
The Spirit's testimony
At Jesus Christ's baptism
After Jesus Christ's ascension
The Holy Spirit's witness enables believers to be effective
He brings assurance to believers
He gives assurance of the finality of Jesus Christ's saving work
He gives believers confidence in their status as children of God
Holy Spirit, work in the world
children.comment: The Holy Spirit, active in the created world, works to show the futility and sinfulness of life without God, and brings a conviction of the presence of God, his righteousness and coming judgment.

children.title: The Holy Spirit is active in the created world
In creation itself
In ordering the natural world
The Holy Spirit is present everywhere in the world
The unbelieving world will not recognise the Holy Spirit

primaryrefs.comment: John uses ``the world'' to describe those who live apart from God.

children.title: The Holy Spirit testifies to the truth
The Holy Spirit convicts the world
The Holy Spirit empowers the church to serve the world in mission
